summary: So why do you think Jon will end up killing Dany in the books? Do you think she'll actually go crazy? Because GRRM said multiple...
question: So why do you think Jon will end up killing Dany in the books? Do you think she'll actually go crazy? Because GRRM said multiple times that the main beats are gonna be the same, at least for the main characters, and Jon killing Dany seems like a pretty important beat
answer:
Jon killed Dany not because she went crazy, but because she went extremely tyrannical over this lip-service called “breaking the wheel.” That’s the specific context of her death. This is honestly what I’m more concerned about—that Martin gave D&D broad strokes about how Dany’s fight for freedom becomes corrupted that pushed Jon to kill her.

To have Jon kill Dany to forge lightbringer (literally or metaphorically) to fight the Others is an extremely different context compared to what we were presented. If this is the broad stroke Martin provided, D&D are extremely reckless for completely decontextualizing the reason behind why she had to be killed by Jon. It’s no longer the same. Not in terms of narrative level, in terms of conceptual level, in terms of the message it’s supposed to send.

So, for me, it’s either the first case (which I hate), or either Martin was tentative when he provided his endgoals. He probably didn’t know how to wrap the story at that point. For example, If we can make an argument that they combined fAegon with Jon’s storyline, wouldn’t it also be possible that fAegon will attempt to kill Dany to fulfill the Azor Ahai prophecy? He seems to be that kind of a person who will believe in its literal reading. If the realm found out he is alive, it’s possible that another red priestest would try to talk to him about this whole Lightbringer prophecy. Again, we don’t know for sure. He may have actually succeeded in killing her, but see there’s this another rumor that says there was a deleted scene in which Dany was resurrected. What if that happens in the book?

I’m curious about the resurgence of this theory because it seems the main reasons why Nissa-Nissa was brought up is 1) the way Jon killed Dany, and 2) someone out there pointing out that D&D may have plagiarized a Jonerys fanart that was drawn to depict the Azor Ahai / Nissa-Nissa prophecy.

The fandom already went past this a long time ago—well argued metas are already out there about Dany is Azor Ahai and the dragons as lightbringer, or the Night’s Watch being the Lightbringer. Or how Azor Ahai is a story, not a prophecy that has to be fulfilled.

caption:
game of thrones challenge  → week 2 / favorite male character

                                                         jon snow

“ You all crowned me your king. I never wanted it. I never asked for it. But I accepted it because the North is my home! It’s part of me, and I will never stop fighting for it, no matter the odds! “

summary: If it was up to you, how would you end GoT? :)
question: If it was up to you, how would you end GoT? :)
answer:
Oh boy that’s a tough question but I’ll try

Daenerys: Never goes mad or burns KL but ends up getting the iron throne. After the war against Cersei is done she is crowned queen of the five kingdoms (-the north and the iron islands) and marries Jon. In their last scene together a bump is visible on her belly indicating that she is pregnant with their first child. Rheagal never dies.

Jon: Kills the Night King. Accepts his identity as both a Targaryen and a Stark and rules in KL with his wife. Ghost dislikes the warm weather but after a good shave and a personal swimming pool he’s fine.

Sansa: QITN! QITN! QITN!

Arya: Sails west but eventually returns to Westeros. Settles down at Storm’s End and marries Gendry. Visits her remaining family regularly. Alternatively traveling the world with Gendry.

Bran: Becomes a higher power or a tree or something Idk. The writers fucked him up. Perhaps it would be nice if he married Meera and reclaimed his humanity somehow. Or stayed in WF with Sansa.

Cersei: Strangled by Jaime after she wants to burn down KL with wildfire.

Jaime: Sleeps with Brienne after the Battle of Winterfell but leaves for KL after he hears about his sister’s plans. He promises Brienne to come back to her afterwards and admits that he loves her. She accepts but eventually changes her mind and decides to go after him. After Cersei is killed he gets stabbed by Euron but manages to stay alive long enough for Brienne to find him. He dies in her arms.

Tyrion: The writers have done him dirty since season 4. They completely messed up his character by putting him in the background. In later seasons the only things he does is crack stupid jokes and fuck up Dany’s plans. And since he has proven to be such a shitty hand (remember the seven years, anyone??) It would’ve left a bitter taste in my mouth seeing him continue to serve the queen. I guess it would’ve been kind of nice seeing him make his own wine in some distant corner of the world but I would’ve been just as fine with him dying too.

Sam: Grand Maester and happily married to Gilly.

Missandei & Greyworm: Alive and still part of Dany’s squad. Going on occasional vacations to Naarth.

Jorah: Serves as Dany’s new hand.

Theon: Sansa’s Hand and not so secret lover. She wants to marry him but he doesn’t want to be king. Perhaps he will agree to it one day. Hero of Winterfell. Forgiven by everyone. Forms a close friendship with Pod. If anyone deserved a happy ending it was Theon. (And Sansa)

Brienne: After Jaime, she returns to the north to serve as Sansa’s Queen’s Guard. Perhaps she maybe possibly probably starts to like Tormund after some time has gone by. Just a bit.

Podrick: Becomes ser Podrick Payne. Stays with Brienne and Sansa. Hangs out with Theon.

Davos: Master of Ships. Jon’s most trusted adviser.

Bronn: Gets his damn castle I suppose. I couldn’t care less.

Qyburn: Killed by the Mountain. I loved Qyburn’s death. His experiment was too bold in the end indeed.

Yara: Queen of the Iron Islands. Visits Theon regularly in Winterfell. Mainly to tease him about Sansa.

Sandor: Dies fighting and killing the Mountain.

Euron: killed by Jaime or Yara/Theon.

Melisandre: Dies during the battle of Winterfell.

summary: Convo with my friends 5 yr old son who knows nothing about GoT
body:
Convo with my friends 5 yr old son who knows nothing about GoT

Kid: You know who I think is cute?

Me: who?

Kid: Jon Snow

Me: Yeah? I think so too 😝

Kid: who is the fire one?

Me: That’s Daenerys Targaryen, you can call her Dany.

Kid: Why didn’t something happen there??

Me: 😳

Masterlist

summary: Game of Thrones Preference: What kind of students they were (AU) | Part 2
title: Game of Thrones Preference: What kind of students they were (AU) | Part 2
body:
Jon

Jon known as “knows nothing” didn’t quite match him. Yes, maybe he was terrible at remembering dates taught during History or at doing experiments during Chemistry but not everyone is talented at everything. Despite those two things, Jon was really good at English and it was plain to see he enjoyed having lessons such as German or French where teachers praised his good accent.


Ramsay

Apathetic to what was happening in class or when a teacher asked him a question. Ramsay always seemed to be miles away - except for Biology lessons. Ramsay was fascinated by human’s body, eager to know more which made teacher more than happy and she actually saw some potential in him.


Margaery

As pretty as Margaery is, she was clever and also a quick learner. Maybe she wasn’t the best at Math but when it came to Biology and flowers, there was no better student. It didn’t matter what teacher asked about, Margaery never disappointed, raised her hand and answered correctly. And that was how she managed to amaze not only teacher, but classmates as well.


Theon

Grades? As if he cared about them. This certain word meant nothing to him. To pass or fail the test - why would that matter? According to Theon, what actually mattered was that pretty girl sitting in front of him in the classroom. She had a picture perfect shaped body, which was driving Theon crazy. So naturally, this girl in his sight was distracting him from everything else happening in the class. Not to mention the useless piece of paper to test his knowledge from last week’s lesson lying on the table, empty, with no answers.


Gendry

Gendry was very energetic, so sitting and listening practically for the whole day didn’t exactly suit his taste. What a relief he felt whenever he had PE. He could relax and clear his mind while shaping his body and improving the stamina.


Joffrey

Joffrey, fully aware of his family’s influence, refused to accept and respect any teachers. For his entertainment, he sabotaged the lessons, bullied his classmates and yelled at teachers. “What is this homework even good for?!” was his favorite line. Obviously such behaviour was unbearable and it crossed the line of teachers’ patience. Joffrey eventually ended up with his mom home-schooling him.


Yara

What kind of lesson Yara couldn’t wait to have? It wasn’t English nor Math. If Yara could, she’d have PE every single day. Watching girls as they were changing clothes before and after the lessons felt like true paradise.

reblog.comment:
Jon

Jon known as “knows nothing” didn’t quite match him. Yes, maybe he was terrible at remembering dates taught during History or at doing experiments during Chemistry but not everyone is talented at everything. Despite those two things, Jon was really good at English and it was plain to see he enjoyed having lessons such as German or French where teachers praised his good accent.


Ramsay

Apathetic to what was happening in class or when a teacher asked him a question. Ramsay always seemed to be miles away - except for Biology lessons. Ramsay was fascinated by human’s body, eager to know more which made teacher more than happy and she actually saw some potential in him.


Margaery

As pretty as Margaery is, she was clever and also a quick learner. Maybe she wasn’t the best at Math but when it came to Biology and flowers, there was no better student. It didn’t matter what teacher asked about, Margaery never disappointed, raised her hand and answered correctly. And that was how she managed to amaze not only teacher, but classmates as well.


Theon

Grades? As if he cared about them. This certain word meant nothing to him. To pass or fail the test - why would that matter? According to Theon, what actually mattered was that pretty girl sitting in front of him in the classroom. She had a picture perfect shaped body, which was driving Theon crazy. So naturally, this girl in his sight was distracting him from everything else happening in the class. Not to mention the useless piece of paper to test his knowledge from last week’s lesson lying on the table, empty, with no answers.


Gendry

Gendry was very energetic, so sitting and listening practically for the whole day didn’t exactly suit his taste. What a relief he felt whenever he had PE. He could relax and clear his mind while shaping his body and improving the stamina.


Joffrey

Joffrey, fully aware of his family’s influence, refused to accept and respect any teachers. For his entertainment, he sabotaged the lessons, bullied his classmates and yelled at teachers. “What is this homework even good for?!” was his favorite line. Obviously such behaviour was unbearable and it crossed the line of teachers’ patience. Joffrey eventually ended up with his mom home-schooling him.


Yara

What kind of lesson Yara couldn’t wait to have? It wasn’t English nor Math. If Yara could, she’d have PE every single day. Watching girls as they were changing clothes before and after the lessons felt like true paradise.

blog.title: Hatice

Will man this Trash Dinghy Solo if need be 
strike hard and true, crow (or i'll come back and haunt you) 
 a red swollen plum in my mouth (a milkweed full of blood)
 trash > cannon

tags: fic: strike hard and true crow (or i'll come back and haunt you)
so fic from me! lemme know what you think
summary: The ludicrous impropriety of it, is sweeter than spilling blood in the heart of a sept, of bodies twisted at the base of a heart...
body:
fic: strike hard and true, crow (or i’ll come back and haunt you)

Death has come to bend the knee.

chapter six

The ludicrous impropriety of it, is sweeter than spilling blood in the heart of a sept, of bodies twisted at the base of a heart tree. A wild and cowardly courage that makes him beastly, that reminds him of his beastliness. His very existence blasphemy, his nearness sin.

I deny you.

chapter one - chapter six

summary: Which dragon do you think tyrion and jon will ride?
question: Which dragon do you think tyrion and jon will ride?
answer:
Rhaegal for Jon, Viserion for Tyrion.

The white cyvasse dragon ended up at Tyrion’s feet. He scooped it off the carpet and wiped it on his sleeve, but some of the Yunkish blood had collected in the fine grooves of the carving, so the pale wood seemed veined with red. (Tyrion I, TWOW)

The Lannister colors are red and gold, both of which have now been associated with Viserion (the latter directly, the former through the above symbolism). There’s an argument also that this echoes the Old Gods/Ghost’s coloring, suggesting the opposite theory that Jon will ride Viserion, rather than Tyrion. I can’t disregard the possibility the dragon-and-rider relationships will be switched, but this is one of the things I think the show kept the same.

summary: Should jon ride a dragon, do you think he will warg into it like with ghost? I’ve seen a lot of theories saying that bran will...
question: Should jon ride a dragon, do you think he will warg into it like with ghost? I’ve seen a lot of theories saying that bran will warg into a dragon, but I don’t see why jon wouldn’t be the one since he would actually be riding one. Thank you!
answer:
Warging into dragons would be supremely difficult, since dragons have been established to be some of the most intelligent and dangerous creatures within the ASOIAF world. I don’t discount Bran trying and possibly succeeding, since he is a very powerful greenseer and warg (and as he trains becomes more and more powerful). At the moment, however, we know that sorcery and powerful horns are the go-to for controlling dragons, and that even Euron, an implied greenseer, is placing his bets on Victarion and the horn.

Since Jon, though still a warg, isn’t as powerful as Bran or Euron, I tend to think his abilities will remain secluded to Ghost. The bond he forms with whichever dragon he rides will be influenced by Targaryen blood, whereas his bond with Ghost goes far deeper.

There’s also the possibility that Jon won’t want to telepathically bond with any creature other than Ghost. His interim after death is going to bring them incredibly close, and I wouldn’t be surprised if Jon just outright refused to warg into anything else.

Thanks for the question, anon!
